body: Sounds good to me (but could also be a future improvement, after this PR).

With this new update, I have this error:
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
        at org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap.start(Bootstrap.java:294)
        at org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap.main(Bootstrap.java:428)

        at org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleBase.start(LifecycleBase.java:145)
        ... 17 more


I'm not sure what causes it. @vorburger can provide assistance for this?

It most probably just means that it failed to connect to the database.
Check your log to find out the root cause and see if it's wrong hostname
("can't be reached") or bad uid/pwd.

From what I've seen from the docker-compose.yaml file, the docker instance only creates the databases but does not populate them with sample data(Well atleast I think that's what it does) but I have the feeling that the server needs sample data in the DB inorder to connect/load properly. Not sure if I'm right about this

@awasum or @vorburger I also need some help with this issue.
I am getting java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError at integrationTest that uses the Util.initializeRESTAssured()

Please.. @percyashu , its usually a good idea to finish one task completely and its merged before you move on to the next one. This is good work BTW. So focus on one..Try Googling your error and fix it.

I will look at your PRs tomorrow.

@xurror The error message you are getting is because the fineract server is not connecting to the MySQL server. 
- Either MySQL is not running, so make sure that pod is running
or 
- the database doesn't exist on the MySQL server. Make sure the database exist on the MySQL server. it doesn't have to be prepopulated with data for the fineract server to start-up successfully.
or 
- the MySQL configuration you provide to the fineract server is wrong.
@awasum, Ok will keep searching for a solution.

@kangbreder I would recommend completing the project or making a project to a stable state then resolving the conflicts at the final state.
so that we can release the done part of the docs in the next release

Have you created these two databases `mifosplatform-tenants` & `mifostenant-default`?
The `mifosplatform-tenants` should also have some records populated.
Please follow this https://github.com/openMF/mifosx/wiki/MySQL-Database-Setup

Yes, I have the databases but no populated data.
I'll populate the databases and see how it goes

That should be trivial to fix though, you will just need to replace `findOne()` with `findById(yourId).orElseThrow(() -> new SomeNotFoundException(YourId))`, see #653 and #642 for examples.

Hi @awasum and @mohitsinha , Sorry as I have been off from my work because of some personal reason. I just tried to test locally from James branch and I am getting the following error. Let me know what to do.

![error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23022667/71255391-cefa7680-2353-11ea-8f7d-096bfda510c8.png)

@awasum and @vorburger, I don't know why MySQL 0.1 is the version used.
I found out that the upgraded Flyway does not support outdated MySQL 0.1 when using Drizzle driver and currently supports MySQL 5.1 and newer.
@vorburger , If you have some time before xmas, will you like to review this again and merge if Ok? Travis build is now working.

> @vorburger , If you have some time before xmas, will you like to review this again and merge if Ok? Travis build is now working.

Maybe, its time I squashed this?

@santoshconflux You should delete your local branch and create a new one from remote. The branch name is the same (because of the contribution guidelines) but the code is unrelated (entirely different commits) from what you tested earlier.

I have been doing some research.
I found out from https://github.com/flyway/flyway/issues/2332 that Flyway support  only the official MySQL driver.
Drizzle JDBC driver is incompatible with current Flyway version. I was thinking on changing the drizzle driver to MySQL connector or MariaDB ConnectorJ

This deployment should be good to go once the problem with the docker container is resolved.
It turns out the failure to connect to DB_HOST comes from the docker configuration of fineract-server
I'm currently working on trying to resolve that too

@xurror I have some ideas about these issues. 
Just to be sure, inside the table`mifosplatform-tenants.tenant_server_connections` the `schema_server` should also be  `fineractmysql`.

I have resolved the conflicts on the PR but having this build failure.
Here are the logs https://pastebin.com/DKzcGgZE
Please can i get some help with this?

> having this build failure. Please can i get some help with this?

This is because this PR, as is, also modifies *.gradle build script files.. and many more, check out the _Files change_ and _Commits_ tabs on this PR, and you'll see what I mean, it looks like this would revert unrelated previous changes - which I'm sure isn't what you are proposing here, but something in your local git operations has gone wrong. @Sanyam96 are you able to help @kangbreder to get this to a clean state? Please feel free to shout if you need me or @awasum to assist.
@DylanRobson we'll assume that you have no interest in this PR anymore, and will just close it (unmerged) on 2020.01.31.

@MexinaD I was curious if you wanted to address the feedback, or abandon this?

I'll close this PR on 2020.01.31 if there are no updates until then; FYI @edcable.
@santoshconflux unless we here otherwise from you by 2020.01.10, I would invite @mohitsinha @awasum to merge this PR by January 11th latest, hope that seems fair at this point.

> I was thinking on changing the drizzle driver to MySQL connector or MariaDB ConnectorJ

unfortunately we cannot, due to licensing issues; look at my comment from June 11 in https://github.com/flyway/flyway/issues/2332 which you found... in theory, the best way to get out of this impasse would probably be to contribute a fix to Flyway (an active project) or https://github.com/krummas/DrizzleJDBC/issues/46 (dead project?). 

If we cannot do that (anyone reading this interested?), then perhaps we should just give up on this.

> the best way to get out of this impasse would probably be to contribute a fix to Flyway (an active project) or [krummas/DrizzleJDBC#46](https://github.com/krummas/DrizzleJDBC/issues/46) (dead project?).
> If we cannot do that (anyone reading this interested?), then perhaps we should just give up on this.

I think the issue lies with the https://github.com/krummas/DrizzleJDBC and since it has been inactive for a while now we should just give up on it.

The problem is that unfortunately we apparently can't use that other MySQL
JDBC driver, due to licensing issues (no LGPL at ASF).

@kangbreder the solution you are going for here seems to be to manually clean up the build script with additional commits? What you really want to do instead is to not have that many commits (155!), and make this PR only have your changes... have you tried to simply do a `git rebase` instead?

> @kangbreder the solution you are going for here seems to be to manually clean up the build script with additional commits? What you really want to do instead is to not have that many commits (155!), and make this PR only have your changes... have you tried to simply do a `git rebase` instead?

I've just emailed you privately re. this.

Re. the build failure, I'm curious if this passes when we retry tomorrow.. see https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-820.

Hm, looks like fixing FINERACT-820 is not quite as trivial as this? I'll close this again, for now.

> @awasum build failure went away simply by retrying.. want to review this?

Its now monday. lol

@kangbreder this PR is now looking much much better than ever before - congratulations!

There are just 2 conflicts, due to the recent merge of #678 - could you manually resolve those? Once those conflicts are resolved and when this passes the builds, then this looks good to me, and I'm happy to merge it ASAP - let's still get this into release 1.4.0! @Sanyam96 @awasum  does this have LGTM from you guys as well, as-is?

PS: One thing I would love to understand better, and I'm sure others would like to as well, is how this will actually be used? I'm sure to you this is "obvious", but to all those of us who have not been involved in the details this GSOC project, would it be possible to have some "doc" for this? It doesn't matter if initially it's given here or in [FINERACT-733](https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-733) or may be somewhere on the Apache Confluence Wiki. Just to understand, once we merge this, what does this actually "do" - you know what I mean? I gather these two new Gradle plugins you are adding ([io.swagger.core.v3.swagger-gradle-plugin](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-core/tree/master/modules/swagger-gradle-plugin) and [org.hidetake.swagger.generator](https://github.com/int128/gradle-swagger-generator-plugin)) do... what - just generate the src/main/resources/swagger-ui/response.json file? Can I ask why we need 2 plugins to generate 1 file? :smiling_imp: Or do these to more

I can see that file already exists now, but I'm not clear where that's coming from, and how it was initially built.. does someone else know? @vishwasbabu or @Sanyam96 perhaps? Is that this PR contributes, in essence, really the automatic build of that file?

If that new src/main/resources/swagger-ui/response.json file is (now) a generated artifact, then why is it in Git, and generated under src/ instead of just being put in the right place under build/ so that it ends up in the WAR? Perhaps that could be contributed as a follow-up once we have merged this?

Merged this now, due to general silence... hope no objections for everyone.

@jamesidw thanks for the contribution! Sorry it took so long to get this merged. We hope to see more from you!

@aimanoj this PR now has merge conflict, likely due to today's merge of #669 by @jamesidw. Will you rebase and resolve it? It would be cool if this could still make it into a 1.4.0 release.

PS: I'm actually confused by who of you wrote the new `UserAdministrationTest.java` and who then copied it from the other, but it doesn't really matter much... :smile: FYI both what I would do in the future is not copy/paste, but actually take the other persons git commit (e.g. `git cherry-pick`, or just `hub checkout` using https://hub.github.com, and then new branch).

@awasum I'd like to get this in (sorry my delay-...), so I'm going to go about reviewing it differently - I'll pull your branch, squash all of your work into a single commit (with you as the commit's author!), quickly  resolve the (trivial) merge conflict caused by #678 myself, and then add one single new commit with changes I would have suggested you make in the final round of review, and then raise a new PR for you to re-review and self-merge - hope that's OK with you?

> @awasum I'd like to get this in (sorry my delay-...), so I'm going to go about reviewing it differently - I'll pull your branch, squash all of your work into a single commit (with you as the commit's author!), quickly resolve the (trivial) merge conflict caused by #678 myself, and then add one single new commit with changes I would have suggested you make in the final round of review, and then raise a new PR for you to re-review and self-merge - hope that's OK with you?

Thanks. Go ahead and do it. I have been waiting for this so i can do the other related checkstyle, pmd and other quality checks.

@vorburger I wrote the class in #660 which got merged. Then the commit was reversed and I submitted a new PR #669 but used the same test class (with some minor changes). I suspect the test class got carried over between these two events( this PR was raised before the reversal)...so this is most likely an accident

Wait a second @awasum FYI I screwed up the rebase & squash... :smiling_imp: this (as is) was NOT your latest #670 but an intermediate previous version; I'm redoing it now, hope I didn't confuse you if you already looked at this - I'll ping you again when this is fully ready.

@awasum the remaining integration test failures are in `LoanReschedulingWithinCenterTest`. I noticed only now that your original PR #670 changed the expected "interest due" in that same test. You seem to have added that in your last commit re. "Fix more spotbugs failures and integration tests" in the original PR.

That's... interesting, and probably merits more investigation? It looks like one of the changes we're making here for SpotBugs is causing a discrepancy. Either we found a pretty major real functional bug, or we broke the main functionality... which one is it? :question:

PS: Interestingly, my PR expects a different result than yours; the original was 90.82 & 41.05, you changed it to 42.38 & 19.16, whereas my results are 84.76 & 38.31 (so closer).

PPS: The "expected" and "was" in the `ComparisonFailure` is the wrong way around.

@awasum if you don't mind I would suggest that we (I'll let you) close this PR, and continue (together) based on #682?  (You could of course any time due the same I did and re-fork that branch from me to try to make further changes, it's probably just easier if we go forward from the "cleaner" single squashed rebased one.)
Definitely closing this in favour of #682 (which is now green).
@awasum this is nwo green. Notice the 2nd commit on this PR, which reverts that test's change. Merge?
This is looking good. What did I miss?
Is this still relevant?

Which one are you merging first. This or #682 ?

@vorburger thanks very much for taking the time to review and augment the spotbug integration work. I am grateful.

@vorburger Thank you. I have resolved the conflicts. 

The response.json file is the OpenAPI specification file which is used to generate the swagger-ui. 
The already existing response.json file in src/main/resources/swagger-ui/ is the spec generated with the request https://localhost:8443/fineract-provider/api/v1/swagger.json. Every time a modification is done on the swagger docs or a new swagger doc is added, this spec needs to be generated again at runtime and the response.json file as well updated so that the modifications can be seen on the UI. 

The io.swagger.core.v3.swagger-gradle-plugin is a plugin i had added to automatically generate the specs during build time and not at run time. This was so that every time one builds on the project, the response.json updates. But this did not work as expected. I had removed the plugin from the build script. I am wondering how its still in there. probably while i have rebasing and resolving conflicts, that came back in the script. I will remove the plugin. 

The other plugin org.hidetake.swagger.generator is used to generate code from the openAPI spec file using swagger-codegen. So this does not generate response.json. It rather uses response.json to generate client code. You

@vorburger i think you have a nice idea. Is it possible to get the file and the swagger-ui in the war? 
That is actually what is needed to be done. Presently the file is manually generated and updated each time.

@kangbreder thank you for making the PR more stable.

I'll test your changes very soon so that we can merge and release your changes in the next cycle release cycle.

@vorburger 
I also agree with you regarding usability.
I think we should document somewhere, maybe at a centric place and also provide the link in the readme so that other devs can refer the swagger-docs and how to use swagger docs in the future.


I am also not sure, about the plugins, do we require it or not, right now.
I will review this PR, and provide my feedback and required changes to this PR.

@vorburger @vishwasbabu @edcable 
Ready to be merged
Reopened a new PR after a rebase #686
Reopened a new PR after a rebase #687

> Which one are you merging first. This or #682 ?

#682 just merged, this one was actually just an extension with 1 more additional commit over that one. There's no real good way to do this better in GitHub (that I know of), so what I "imply" (but should say more clearly?) when I raise a PR like this one for review is to manually click on the last commit of such a PR (in the _Commits_ tab) in review that, instead of everything on the _Files changed_ tab (or use that Changes from drop down on _Files changed_ to review only last commit instead of _from all commits_).

> @vorburger thanks very much 

You are the one to thank, this (that we've finally properly adopted SpotBugs here) is amazing!

If this small PR is OK with you, just go ahead and merge it (use _Rebase and merge_ to avoid the merge commit, because #684 is "parallel"). -- PS: I hope this doesn't fail in Integration Test again due to [FINERACT-820](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-820) - as it's Sunday...  if it does, we really should figure out how to fix that problem.. or ask on list if anyone would like to take that on.

> Is this still relevant?

Yes, very much so; this contains more but new SpotBugs related / inspired clean up which I coded on top of your recent work! See #685 re. how this was meant to be reviewed as an addendum to #682 .. now that is in, the diff will look clearer. The Conflicts shown are bogus (I don't really understand why GitHub is that stupid; a simple `git rebase` on the CLI fixes them).

I'm just looking into why `ShareAccountIntegrationTests` (only) fails on this PR. Maybe I'll break it up into smaller ones.
@jamesidw will you rebase and resolve conflicts?

>  PS: I hope this doesn't fail in Integration Test again due to [FINERACT-820](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-820) - as it's Sunday... if it does, we really should figure out how to fix that problem.. or ask on list if anyone would like to take that on.

It did, this is really annoying.. are you willing to just review and merge this ignoring that `LoanReschedulingWithinCenterTest` failure? Or motivated to investigate how that could be fixed properly once and for all? I'll drop an email to the list as well.

> why `ShareAccountIntegrationTests` (only) fails on this PR

specifically `testCreateShareAccountWithCharges()` in line 487 `Assert.assertEquals("0.0", String.valueOf(chargeDef.get("amountOutstanding")));` ... I've manually reverted some of the changes of this PR to understand which one causes that failure, and figured it must be related to one of those `hashCode()` and `equals()` changes in `Charge`, `TrialBalance`, `LoanProductProvisioningEntry`, `LoanProductBorrowerCycleVariations` or `ShareAccountCharge`. Hm.

The `ShareAccountIntegrationTests.testCreateShareAccountWithCharges()` failure was related to `ShareAccountCharge`, something is really wrong there... to move forward with getting all the rest of the changes proposed here merged ASAP, I've reverted the `hashCode()` and `equals()` changes in `ShareAccountCharge` from here for now; let's pick that up in dedicated [FINERACT-827](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-827). With that, I expect that this PR will now pass CI IT (unless it's Sunday, in which case it will fail due to [FINERACT-820](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-820), which is totally unrelated to everything else here).

> @vorburger Thank you. I have resolved the conflicts.

following the merge of #682, there now is a new conflict again already... will you resolve, again?

I think to avoid that happening again and again, we should try to get a minimal version of this PR merged ASAP, and then incrementally iterate on improving it in separate follow-up PRs.

> The io.swagger.core.v3.swagger-gradle-plugin is a plugin i had added to automatically generate the specs during build time and not at run time. This was so that every time one builds on the project, the response.json updates. But this did not work as expected. I had removed the plugin from the build script. I am wondering how its still in there. probably while i have rebasing and resolving conflicts, that came back in the script. I will remove the plugin.

OK, cool. From my side, we could perhaps merge this PR after you've done that (but @Sanyam96 more than me should fully review and LGTM this).

> @vorburger i think you have a nice idea. Is it possible to get the file and the swagger-ui in the war?

Yeah, I think it should be. @Sanyam96 can probably work with you towards that. Again, I would suggest that we get this PR to a state where it can be merged even if it can still be improved in follow-up you can raise in separate new PRs.

This PR only make whitespace clean up changes, and nothing else.  This can be "proven" by locally doing a `git diff -w` on it, or inspecting https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/688/files?w=1.

See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-821 for full background.
@wkk91193 this fails the `SchedulerJobsTest` integration test (and has rebase conflicts)

@wkk91193 this now fails to build due to the recent Spring version upgrade ... That should be trivial to fix though, you will just need to replace `findOne()` with `findById(yourId).orElseThrow(() -> new SomeNotFoundException(YourId)`, see e.g. #653 and #642 for examples.
This actually broke more than it improved but #690 fixes it again.
LGTM. Merging now.
